name: Twice-Baked Potatoes
headline: Twice-Baked Potatoes
description: Ree Drummond stuffs her classic Twice-Baked Potatoes with bacon, sour cream and lots of cheese. This easy recipe can't be beat.
keywords: Easy Side Dish Recipes,Easy,Side Dish,Easy Baking,Cheesy Potatoes,Cheese,Potato,Vegetable,Baked Potato,Bacon Recipes,Meat,Gluten Free
recipeIngredient: 1 cup Cheddar or Jack cheese (or a mix of both), plus more for topping

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Place the potatoes on a baking sheet. Rub them with the canola oil and bake for 1 hour, making sure they're sufficiently cooked through.
Slice the butter into pats. Place in a large mixing bowl and add the bacon bits and sour cream. Remove the potatoes from the oven. Lower the heat to 350 degrees F.

With a sharp knife, cut each potato in half lengthwise. Scrape out the insides into the mixing bowl, being careful not to tear the shell. Leave a small rim of potato intact for support. Lay the hollowed out potato shells on a baking sheet.

Smash the potatoes into the butter, bacon and sour cream. Add the cheese, milk, seasoned salt, green onions and black pepper to taste and mix together well. (IMPORTANT: If you plan to freeze the twice-baked potatoes, do NOT add the green onions.)

Fill the potato shells with the filling. I like to fill the shells so they look abundant and heaping. Top each potato with a little more grated cheese and pop 'em in the oven until the potato is warmed through, 15 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Can you make the potatoes ahead of time?

I‚Äôve been making this recipe for years now. I always double the recipe since it takes almost as long to make 16 as it does 8. They freeze great. I add the scallions even though they turn dark green when frozen. Similar to basil when it‚Äôs too cold. It doesn‚Äôt change the flavor at all. Once frozen on a sheet pan, I place them in a storage container with parchment paper between layers and pull out as many as I need when I want them. My husband loves them. Thanks Ree for a great recipe!
Even my super picky mother loved these and she almost never has anything nice to say.
Best Ever Twice Baked Potatoes!  I‚Äôve always been afraid to try making these. Ree‚Äôs instructions made it easy. Delicious!
I used my cookie scoop to hollow out shells. Works great & easily controlled.  Thank you Ree and Food Network for this recipe!

These were a huge hit! I made them to go with a brisket my husband smoked, so I was able to replace half of the butter smoked beef tallow. This brought the flavor over the top. I also recommend putting salt and pepper on the potato skins before first run cooking them.
Easy and delicious.  The family LOVED them and requested I make them again....Yumm!
Question please? If frozen, should they be thawed first or baked from frozen? Temp and time if from frozen?
Easy recipe that the entire family loved!
Best twice baked potatoes!  Can't wait to make them again.
it was so good
Easy to follow instruction,and extremely tasty.
Make them every year!
I love all her recipies
My go-to recipe for twice-baked potatoes. I half the recipe for two people. Watch the salt. Otherwise prepare just as written.

Excellent recipe. I used half the butter, substituted plain Greek yogurt for sour cream and kept it simple by using bacon bits.   Turned out perfect and even my picky kids enjoyed them. Will definitely make again!
Yummy!
Super delicious the whole family loved it
My favorite way to make baked potatoes. I have made them several times following the recipe exactly. The are always a hit.
Well, these are fabulous. Made exactly as-is, they are lovely. Add a little hot sauce, and they are lovelier. Just great.

This is the only recipe I use for twice baked potatoes. I‚Äôve been making this recipe for 5 years for my husbands birthday and it never fails to please. We scale it back to only two potatoes so it‚Äôs an easy recipe to modify.

I used 6 small/medium baking potatoes and cut the other ingredients in half. I use kosher salt on the outside of my potatoes and if you do too, you might want to slightly reduce the seasoned salt. At first the mixture looked way too runny after adding the milk but as I stirred in the cheese, salt, and 1 tbs horseradish (spur of the moment family decision ) it came together to a nice consistency. I‚Äôd recommend adding milk a bit at a time as you mix to get to the texture you like since potato sizes vary so widely. Very good base recipe to riff on with added onions, garlic, etc.

Pauline from Texas
Awesome recipe!! Everyone loved them with our ribeye‚Äôs!! Hubby says its a keeper recipe! Ree I make many of your recipes, and you don‚Äôt disappoint! Creamy and flavorful, better than restaurants!!!
Made these for Father‚Äôs Day, and they were a huge hit!! I subbed Greek yogurt for sour cream and used turkey bacon‚Äî delicious!!!
Delicious.  I didn‚Äôt have fresh scallions, but I substituted dried scallions with 1/2 large shallot- minced! Perfect Fathers Day addition to beef tenderloin

So so good. I did make a few adjustments.

I halved the recipe for a smaller group. Added more milk as I wanted the stuffing to be creamy, and melted the butter before whipping it, with the sour cream of course. I added Trader Joe's ranch seasoning in place of seasoning salt. Then I added the cheese, bacon and green onion before folding it together. It was so tasty I couldn't help having a nibble on the stuffing while still in the bowl!
I pre-planned this meal and had time to bake the potatoes ahead of time. I waited until they cooled before scooping the centers out. If time permits, I highly recommend this. Now they're stuffed, waiting in the fridge, all ready to be popped into the oven!

Thanks for the inspo, Ree! We have one of your cook books and the recipes are always üî•
Fantastic, added roast garlic since our house really likes garlic. A little extra bacon and used thick bacon this really rocked
These are not unique but they are quite good. Very easy to make and often the ingredients are in your refrigerator. Recommend giving these a try!
Have made these a few times and they‚Äôre always amazing!! I usually cut the recipe in half to end up with 8 potato halves. They reheat perfectly and are always tasty!!!
So easy a  marine could do it. And now requested at all family events.
Cut down on half the amount of milk
Great!

We haven‚Äôt eaten these yet but I‚Äôve done a lot of tasting and know they‚Äôll be good. I‚Äôve made a 5# bag, have 24 halves. I used a whole pint of sour cream and not as much milk.  I‚Äôve added a lot of seasoning called Colorado smoke. My concern is that in many of Bree‚Äôs videos she has sleeves hanging in her food. Not good. What would be worse is if she‚Äôs cooking on her gas range. They could easily catch fire. That isn‚Äôt something a new cook watching the show might think about. Teach safety too.

She does specify ‚Äúbaking potatoes‚Äù and when I tried to get a bag from the grocery store, some of them were wee ones. The cup of milk would have been great if the potatoes would have been up to size but otherwise, mine was a little runnier than I would have liked. Otherwise, Ree strikes again as a great go-to!

I substituted goat cheese for the sour cream, and omitted the bacon as I don‚Äôt like it in these, and I added a minced shallot I caramelized in butter just before adding to my mixture. I loved these as a kid but my mom had only fed us frozen ones and this was my first time making them from scratch. Incredible!
Super tasty and easy and moist and have doogh with it
This was an easy and delicious dish!!
Simple recipe and loved by all.

Mmmmmmmmmmmmm-
These turned out soooooo well!
Very creamy texture. Worth the effort!
Mine were supper runny, followed the recipe
I served these potatoes with my prime rib roast for Christmas dinner and they were a huge hit.  It's a keeper recipe!
My family loved this recipe!  I will make it again.
I adjusted the milk and butter since my potatoes on the smaller side. ¬†
These are delicious, but 2 sticks of butter are way too much for me. I used 1 stick and kept everything else the same.

These were really good!¬† My family thought it was perfect with our meal.¬† I used 4 potatoes and half the recipe.¬† I may have had smaller potatoes so when I baked them the second time, some of the filling ran out because it was so creamy.¬† My suggestion for others with smaller potatoes, that are not the huge baking potatoes, is to go easy on the milk when mixing or leave it out until you see how creamy the mixture is.¬† This recipe is a keeper!¬†
These are the best, you can make them ahead and just pop them in the oven when you‚Äôre ready for dinner.
This is a great recipe. I always use leftover baked potatoes and it comes out great every time!!!

I made this dish but I put way too much butter, what is two sticks of butter, I looked it up and it said one stick = 113 grams.. I had to add more potato's. Even though they were scrumptious.. One more question, I stopped before baking them again, as I premade them for today. They are in the fridge ready to go, how long do you think I need to reheat them for them to be warmed through? I have a lot of friends coming round tonight so I don't want to stuff it up :)¬†
These potatoes are delish!!!! I definitely recommend them!!

These were amazing!! The only thing I did differently was I topped them with a lot more cheese, bacon, and green onions before placing them back into the oven. My husband said they were restaurant quality! We were very impressed! The only other thing I would have changed was‚Ä¶ I wish I would have made more of them!! Haha! I highly recommend this recipe!

This is an AWESOME recipe. Started making it a few years back as a FATHERS‚Äô Day treat‚Ä¶.Became quite the hit even among my finicky grandchildren who say the don‚Äôt like potatoes! If there are leftovers, (HaHa) they reheat well!
Will definitely try freezing some after reading the reviews of people who have had so much success with freezing!
Delicious, my teenage daughter loved it. Very simple for non-cooks, such as myself!
REEly delicious!!! I've been making these for years! I love the fact that you can add deferent varieties of other ingredients to make these a side course for many, MANY others meals! So diverse!¬†
Really delicious.  Could just eat these for dinner all by themselves.  My family loved them too.

Super easy to follow and delicious. We had a lot going on in our kitchen tonight and I definitely did not add the milk. These were super creamy and smooth without so I can‚Äôt wait to add it in next time (three nights from now I‚Äôm already excited). So happy to add this to my collection!
OMG these are quite the potato treat. I used a little heavy cream and milk mixture cause I‚Äôm savage like that. Reheated the left overs in my air fryer *delish*
My husband loves when I make these! I recommend starting with 1/4 cup of milk then add more as needed. Usually 1 cup makes them too mushy for me. Overall, GREAT recipe! SO GOOD!
Perfect!!

This was easy to follow...twice baked potatoes are always a little more time consuming than I would like, but worth it in the end! ¬†I omitted the bacon because not everyone in my family likes it. ¬†They were very flavorful even without the bacon. ¬†Ree always has the best family recipes! I would absolutely make these again...when I have time!
Fantastic!
The best twice- or even once-baked potato that I have ever eaten
I like to make the entire recipe, wrap and freeze the filled potatoes so that I have them as a quick side for dinner.  Obviously this freezes really well.
Everyone loved them ! Very tasty and not dried out like some twice baked potatoes Followed the recipe exactly and it was pretty easy . Will do this recipe again
Made them tonight! Added some chili flakes. Great and easy recipe!¬†
Great recipe.  ONLY thing I didn't do was put milk in my mixture.  Learned from a previous attempt that it made the mixture too thin.
Turned out great. Followed recipe exactly. Two potatoes turned out to be more than enough for two of us, so saved the other halves for another day. When warmed, they were great, too.
Fabulous!  Eight potatoes make 16 servings. Cut it in half and recipe was perfect. Thanks Ree.
Not sure what happened, but I had WAY too much filling. I could get it all in to the potatoes and what I did get in (heaping as instructed) melted and ran all over the oven.
It seems like a smart way to pre plan dinner.
So good!
Loved this and so did my family!
Great recipe!  I added the milk last and a little at a time until the potatoes were the consistency I wanted.  Great flavor!
Another excellent Ree Drummond recipe! I filled the shells most of the way and then piped the filling on the top for a fancier look.

We make these every year for our Christmas menu with a rib roast and Yorkshire pudding - they are a huge favorite! Because there are only 3 of us, I prepare the full amount of the recipe, but wrap half of them in foil (without the green onions) and freeze for future meals. They defrost well and taste just as good as the day I made them. (We also share some with extended family since they love them too).  These have become a holiday tradition and we all look forward to them!
I followed the recipe and I'm here to say these were the BEST potatoes EVER!!!
Excellent, but I used far less butter. I used about 6 Tablespoons and it was plenty for us (and we are butter lovers! lol). Great recipe that is easily tweaked to suit different tastes.
I took them to another level and smoked them made the filling recipe and smoked them again TO DIE FOR! 50 stars

I made these for Thanksgiving 2020 for our slimmed down crew of 7. They were a total hit. The only change I made was cutting out one stick of butter. I may have added a tad more milk instead. They are very filling/substantial. Lots of leftovers, but that is a plus for everyone.¬†

Also, I did much of the work a day ahead by baking and scooping out the insides on Wednesday. I also cooked up the bacon and shredded the cheese that day. So on Thanksgiving, all I had to do was mash, fill, and bake.¬†
So tasty!

Made some changes but end result was same and so good! Used turkey bacon.  Steamed baked potatoes wrapped in moist paper towel in the microwave, which saves a ton of time.  Then combined all ingredients in individual casseroles and placed in the oven. Loved it!
reduce milk and add 1 cup mayo and 1 tablespoon garlic powder or minced garlic,don,t forget to poke potatoes witn fork before baking
Loved it!

video.name: Ree's Twice-Baked Potatoes
video.description: Ree Drummond whips up Twice-Baked Potatoes for her annual Rancher's dinner.
